issues.description: Constructor parameter mismatch between the template's example usages and the intended class design. The commented example code in the template repository's Main.java instantiates Seal, Pig, and Goat with two parameters (e.g. new Seal("Clarabelle", "marine")). The UML and textual specification in the problem statement describe animals only having a name attribute and ask students to implement constructors that initialize class attributes accordingly. The solution repository implements each animal constructor with a single String parameter (name). The two-argument examples in the template Main are therefore inconsistent and will confuse students about the expected constructor signatures.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the example usage in the template repository consistent with the UML/specification and solution. Update the commented example lines in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Main.java to use single-argument constructors (e.g. new Seal("Clarabelle"), new Pig("Doodle"), new Goat("Buttinsky")). Alternatively, if two attributes were intended, update the UML/problem statement to declare the additional attribute(s) for the animal classes and modify the solution accordingly.

issues.description: Method parameter mismatch for the helper method singFarmSongVerse in the template Farm.java. The UML and solution define singFarmSongVerse(animal: Animal):void (i.e. it accepts an Animal parameter). In the template repository Farm.java the method is declared as private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/) — the parameter is missing and only left inside a comment. This mismatch could cause confusion or compilation problems when students try to call singFarmSongVerse(animal) from singFarmSong() or follow the UML precisely.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the template method signature to match the UML and solution: declare private void singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) and implement or leave a TODO body. This makes the template's structure consistent and avoids compilation/calling confusion when students implement singFarmSong().
